p: Immunomodulators from medicinal mushrooms have been shown to be capable of stimulating both innate and adaptive immune responses. They activate innate immune system components such as natural killer (NK) cells, neutrophils, and macrophages, and stimulate the expression and secretion of cytokines. These cytokines in turn activate adaptive immunity by promoting B cell proliferation and differentiation for antibody production and by stimulating T cell differentiation to T helper (Th) 1 and Th2 cells, which mediate cellular and humoral immunities, respectively [ 154].
